Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
CAN: The student may draw the outline of a fish, but it might lack detail or accuracy.
The student might include some water around the fish, indicating a basic recognition of its need for water.
CANNOT: The student is unlikely to accurately label the fish or its parts (student doesn’t know or understand the parts).
The student probably cannot illustrate or label the habitat correctly, might show a land-based setting (student misunderstanding of 'habitat').
The student likely will not include or label any other living things like plants or animals (student lacks knowledge of ecosystem components).
The student will not show or label resources such as plants that help the fish survive (student doesn’t recognize plant-fish relationships).
The student is unable to demonstrate the relationship between the fish and its environment, like how the fish interacts with water (no clear relationship is shown).
The student might draw unrelated objects with no clear representation of the fish's needs or system interactions (random objects not part of system).
